term.kTAG_LABEL: Descriptors for web-enabled national in situ landrace inventories
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Descriptors For Web-Enabled National In Situ Landrace (LR) Inventories.

node.kTAG_ACKNOWLEDGMENTS: Thanks are due to Adriana Alercia (Bioversity International, Rome), Theo van Hintum (Centre for Genetic Resources _ Wageningen University and Research Centre, the Netherlands) and Lorenzo Maggioni (ECPGR Secretariat, Rome) for helpful suggestions and comments.
node.kTAG_BIBLIOGRAPHY: Bioversity and The Christensen Fund, 2009. Descriptors for farmer’s knowledge of plants. Bioversity International, Rome, Italy and The Christensen Fund, Palo Alto, California, USA.
node.kTAG_NOTES:
Landraces are part of agro-biodiversity in urgent need of conservation. A prerequisite of any active conservation is some form of inventory of what is conserved.

In this context, the EC Framework 7 PGR Secure project is aimed to provide help in generating National Landrace Inventories in European countries and so to begin the process of creating a European Landrace Inventory pivoted on the National Inventories.

A European LR Inventory can only be based on National Inventories considered that the responsibility to conserve and sustainably use landrace diversity (as well as any other biodiversity component) lies with individual Nations and that any concerted action will be implemented at national level, even when driven by policy at European level.

This draft descriptor list was worked out to facilitate the development of National Inventories of landraces that are still maintained in situ (i.e. on farm or in garden).

It was drafted to record different types of information that were discussed at the “Crop Wild Relative and Landrace Conservation Training Workshop” held in Palanga Lithuania, 7-9 September 2011 by the in situ National Inventory Focal Points, the ECPGR Documentation and Information Network members and the PGR Secure team working on landraces.

However, it also takes into account the contribution that the ECPGR On-farm Conservation and Management Working Group of the In Situ and On-Farm Conservation Network gave through years to the definition of descriptors for extant landraces (see draft descriptor list downloadable from http://www.ecpgr.cgiar.org/networks/in_situ_and_on_farm/on_farm_wg.html).

The draft descriptor list includes fields related to the Inventory, taxon, landrace, site and farmer identification, the landrace status, characteristics and use and finally fields concerning conservation and monitoring actions eventually taken in favour of the landrace diversity maintenance.

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Common descriptor data types and enumerations.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Latitude in degrees, minutes and seconds
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Degrees (2 digits) minutes (2 digits), and seconds (2 digits) followed by N (North) or S (South).

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: 45° (i.e. 45 degrees), 4’ (i.e. 4 minutes) and unknown seconds North (Turin latitude) is coded as 450400N
45°, 4’ and 8’’ (i.e. 8 seconds) North (Turin_Mole Antonelliana latitude) is coded as 450408N

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Latitude expressed in decimal degrees.

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: the same latitude of Turin_Mole Antonelliana reported above is coded as 45.069031°
the Madrid latitude reported above is coded as 40.418446°
the Quito latitude reported above is coded as -0.222900°

term.kTAG_LABEL: Longitude in degrees, minutes and seconds
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Degrees (3 digits), minutes (2 digits), and seconds (2 digits) followed by E (East) or W (West).

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: 7° 41’ and unknown seconds E (Turin) is coded as 0074100E (2 zeros before the 7 degrees because longitude varies from 0 and 180 degrees and needs 3 digits)
7° 41’ 36" E (Turin_Mole Antonelliana longitude) is coded as 0074135E

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Longitude expressed in decimal degrees.

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: the same longitude of Turin_Mole Antonelliana reported above is coded as 7.693154°
the same longitude of Madrid reported above is coded as -3.714277°
the same longitude of Quito reported above is coded as -78.505386°°

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Elevation of site expressed in meters above sea level. Negative values are allowed.
This enumeration has two values: 10 for yes and 20 for no.
Descriptors identifying the inventory and origin of the landrace or population.
Descriptors identifying the scientific nomenclature of the landrace or population.
Descriptors identifying the specific landrace or population.
Descriptors identifying the location of the landrace or population.
Descriptors identifying the maintainer of the landrace or population.
Descriptors describing the landrace.
Descriptors covering conservation and maintenance of the landrace or population.

The remarks field is used to add notes or to elaborate on descriptors with value 99 or 999 (=Other). Prefix remarks with the field name they refer to and make them follow by a colon (:). Distinct remarks referring to different fields are separated by semicolons (;) without space.

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: The farmer often observes flower colour instability; PRODUCTUSE: chaff also used for fuel pellet and pillow filling; LRMARKTDEMAND: falling locally but growing in the district nearby.

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Coordinates of the farm house or headquarters, to be recorded as either Degrees Minutes and Seconds-DMS or Decimal Degrees DD as specified below.

Coordinates of the field where the LR is/has been grown in the year the Inventory is compiled; to be recorded as either Degrees Minutes and Seconds-DMS or Decimal Degrees- DD, as described above for ‘Farm coordinates’.

node.kTAG_DESCRIPTION: Country code identifying the National in situ LR Inventory; the code of the country preparing the National Inventory. For country codes use the three-letter ISO 3166-1 [#ISO:3166:1:alpha-3#] (see: http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49alpha.htm).

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Code identifying the edition of the National in situ LR Inventory made up of the edition number and the year of publication.

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: the first edition that is compiled in 2012 will be coded as 001/2012
the second edition that is compiled in 2014 will be coded 002/2014

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: FAO WIEWS code of the institute (see: http://apps3.fao.org/wiews/institute_query.htm?i_l=EN) who is responsible at the national level for the production of the National in situ LR Inventory.

node.kTAG_DESCRIPTION: Genus name for taxon, in Latin. Initial uppercase letter required.
Specific epithet portion of the scientific name, in Latin, in lower case letters.

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: The authority for the species name.

This field can be used to store any additional taxonomic identifier (in Latin, in lower case letters) preceded by the rank (for example: subspecies, convariety, variety, form, cultivar group). The following abbreviations are foreseen for the rank: ‘subsp.’ (for subspecies); ‘convar.’ (for convariety); ‘var.’ (for variety); ‘f.’ (for form), ‘Group’ (for cultivar group).
The subtaxa authority at the most detailed taxonomic level.
Taxonomy used by Inventory compiler to identify the material (e.g.. The Plant List, Euro+Med PlantBase, GRIN taxonomy, etc).
Name of the crop in colloquial language, preferably English if any.
Date on which the LR was recorded in the current in situ Inventory, as YYYYMMDD. Missing data (MM or DD) should be indicated with zeros. Leading zeros are required.

Unique progressive number which identifies the in situ LR in the Inventory, not to be duplicated (i.e. reassigned) for other LRs or the same LR that is cultivated by other farmers in the current Inventory. To be assigned by the institute which is responsible at the national level for the production of the National LR in situ Inventory.
Local name/s of the LR in the colloquial language of the farm. Free text.
The language code of the LR local name. Use ISO 639-2 is the alpha-3 code in Codes for the representation of names of languages (see: http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639- 2/php/code_list.php).

term.kTAG_LABEL: Farm location: primary administrative subdivision of the country where farm is located
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Name of the primary administrative subdivision of the country where the farm is located for the most part of its extension. Free text.
Name of the secondary administrative subdivision (within the primary administrative subdivision) of the country where the farm is located. Free text.
Name of the lowest administrative subdivision (i.e. municipality). Free text.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Location of the nearest known place
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Information relevant to the nearest known place, distance from nearest named place, and directions from the nearest named place. Descriptive field as detailed as possible. Free text.

kTAG_EXAMPLES.item: 7 km south of Panicale towards Perugia on SS.74

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: The geodetic datum or spatial reference system upon which the coordinates given in decimal latitude and decimal longitude are based. If not known, use ‘not recorded’, when not known the default WGS 1984 Datum will be used.
Data recorded by GPS: Yes or No.

To be compiled if the field GPS is ‘No’. The upper limit of the distance (in meters) from the given latitude and longitude describing a circle within which the whole of the described locality must lie.

The geodetic datum or spatial reference system upon which the coordinates given in decimal latitude and decimal longitude are based. If not known, use ‘not recorded’, when not known the default WGS 1984 Datum will be used.
Data recorded by GPS: Yes or No.

To be compiled if the field GPS is ‘No’. The upper limit of the distance (in meters) from the given latitude and longitude describing a circle within which the whole of the described locality must lie.

Unique number identifier of the farmer who maintains the LR and provides information (Landrace maintainer unique ID to be held in database). It is assigned by the institute that is responsible at the national level for the production of the National LR in situ Inventory. This number should not be duplicated or reassigned to other unit. This number should be composed of the ‘National Inventory Code (NICODE 1.1.)’ + ’National Inventory Edition Number (1.2.NIENUMB)’ + ’Landrace number (3.2. LRNUMB)’.
Recorded as YYYY. If not certain, indicate that this is an estimate in REMARKS.
Multiple choices are allowed since the farm can be made of several types of holdings. Multiple choices are allowed separated by a semicolon (;) without space.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
"Restriction in making the above mentioned (i.e. 5.2. and 5.3.) farmer data publicly available: ‘Yes’ or ‘No’. If ‘No’ only FARMERID (5.1) will be public.
The total area (ha) cultivated under the inventoried LR on that farm as from farmer statement.

The length of time the LR was cultivated on that farm as from farmer memory, i.e. cultivated for an unknown number of years, over 50 years, less than 50 years; in the latter case it can be specified the time.

The status of the LR on that farm, i.e. whether inherent the farm or reintroduced in the farm as from farmer statement. For ‘inherent the farm’ a cultivation period over 25 years in that farm should be intended. If introduced/reintroduced from other farms it can be specified from where. To be eventually elaborated in REMARKS.
Should match with LRCULTPER 20 or 33, at least.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Reintroduced by the family which presently cultivates the LR from a different estate belonging to the same family
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: For example: the very same LR has been grown for several decades and generations in the same family at the same farm/garden, but now it is grown at the summer cottage in different district/neighboring house belonging to the same family. Provide details under REMARKS.
Provide Gene Bank name in REMARKS.
Introduced/Reintroduced from other farms: neighbouring farm.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Introduced/Reintroduced from farm in the same district
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Introduced/Reintroduced from other farms: farm in the same district.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Introduced/Reintroduced from farm in different district/country
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Introduced/Reintroduced from other farms: farm in different district/country.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
From where the seed (or propagation material in general) initially came, as from farmer statement.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Exchanges between close villages via barter system
Certified material from the seed market

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Genebank (to be specified from which genebank in REMARKS).
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
Whether the LR maintainer plans to continue to grow LR for the foreseeable future.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Will continue, but considers changing within a few years
Will continue as long as possible

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
Whether the LR maintainer plans to give/exchange the LR to/with other growers.
Yes, to relative.
Yes, to friend or neighbour.
Yes, to another grower.
Yes, to seed/seedlings-swap event.
Yes, to plant genebank.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Farmer motivations for growing the landrace
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Taken from farmer statement. See codes in the table below. Multiple choices are allowed separated by a semicolon (;) without space.
Precocity (early development or maturity).
Abiotic factors: cold.
Abiotic factors: drought.
Abiotic factors: high humidity.
Abiotic factors: salinity.
Biotic factors: fungal/bacterial/virus.
Biotic factors: insect/nematode/etc.

term.kTAG_LABEL: Ritual or religious use of the community

term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Quality traits (taste, fragrance, colour, etc.).
Market traits (good storability, easy transformation etc.).
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
The main criteria farmer uses when selecting material for propagation.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
Part/s of the plant used by the farmer, as from farmer statement. Multiple choices are allowed separated by a semicolon (;) without space.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).

Type of use of the product obtained from the LR: if as direct product or as processed product for larger use, as from farmer statement. Multiple choices are allowed separated by a semicolon (;) without space.
Food (e.g. vegetable, soups).
Long term storage culinary product (e.g. canned food).
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
Where the product from the LR is mainly destined for use, as from farmer statement.
In local market.
In district / regional markets.
In national markets.
In international sale.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
Demand for LR / LR product as from farmer statement.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).

term.kTAG_LABEL: Loss risk as for the farmer
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Risk of losing this LR as perceived by the interviewed farmer. It helps to decide if conservation is needed and plan monitoring actions.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).

term.kTAG_LABEL: Loss risk as assessed by the collecting team
term.kTAG_DEFINITION: Risk of losing this LR as perceived by the team recording data. It helps to decide if conservation is needed and plan monitoring actions.
Other (elaborate in REMARKS).
Whether any structured and funded in situ conservation action related to the LR is in place at the moment of the Inventory compilation.
Educational actions (didactic gardens, living museum etc.).
Other (To be specified in REMARKS).).
To be compiled if CONSERVACTIONS is ‘Yes’. Name of the Authority/Public subject/Farmer organisation/Foundation that has organised the conservation action. Free text.
Whether any monitoring of the in situ maintenance of LR is foreseen across years. Yes or No.
To be compiled if MONIT is ‘Yes’. Indicate who is in charge of monitoring. Free text.
To be compiled if MONIT is ‘Yes’. Indicate the monitoring interval in years.
State if a sample was collected for safety duplication in gene bank. Yes or No.

To be filled in if the answer of EXSECURE (7.6) is ‘Yes’. FAO WIEWS institute code/s of the institute/s where an ex situ safety duplicate of the landrace has been eventually deposited. The codes consist of the 3-letter ISO 3166 country code of the country where the institute is located plus a number. Multiple codes are separated by a semicolon (;) without space.
